intro: Scopolina tangutica, commonly known as the Tangut bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Scopolina tangutica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
